name: NPR
text: While Trump did note that storms are more frequent and stronger than those decades ago, he did not directly connect that to climate change when asked, saying the area has always been prone to storms. https://t.co/BvpAHsS2Th

name: NPR
text:
RT @hansilowang: NEW: Last-minute changes to the #2020Census the Trump admin directed the Census Bureau to make not only end counting early, but also cut short critical processes to ensure an accurate count. One quality-checking effort has already been quietly scaled back.
https://t.co/tGNbpg0Fd1

name: NPR
text:
Since filing a lawsuit against the Trump administration, Patrick Ryan has become the public face of TikTok employees fed up with Trump's efforts to ban the app because a Chinese company owns it.

"Sometimes it's anxiety. ... Sometimes it's rage," he says.
 https://t.co/OTM5wnRVsf

name: NPR
text: RT @OPB: BREAKING: A person has apparently been shot during a pro-Trump car caravan through downtown Portland, according to multiple reports on the ground. Details emerging. https://t.co/HDptsDfKq3

name: NPR
text:
Despite economic uncertainty and the steepest plunge into a recession on record, the U.S. housing market is booming.

In June, sales of existing homes jumped more than 20%, a record — then that record was immediately broken the following month.
https://t.co/IsmWA4QXDj

name: NPR
text: One person has been fatally shot in Portland, Ore., as a group of supporters of President Trump traveled in a caravan throughout the city, clashing with counter protesters. https://t.co/s2NrIjEYRG

name: NPR
text:
July marked the 3rd consecutive increase in monthly spending — but gains were smaller than in May and June.

Economists warn spending may suffer in August now that supplemental unemployment benefits of $600 a week have expired.
https://t.co/J7Frckyhgj

name: NPR
text:
We asked 5 very different families across the political spectrum the same simple question: What's been keeping you up at night?

Here's what they said.
https://t.co/BDPhY4s6qz

name: NPR
text:
Speakers at the Republican National Convention touted the religious credentials of their own candidates, but they were equally determined to question the faith of their opponents — with Joe Biden their main target.
https://t.co/KN6ogiXBlN

name: NPR
text:
Germans abide by a host of laws to keep noise at a minimum after 10 p.m. and on Sundays. Now, lawmakers have proposed banning motorcyclists from popular routes on Sundays and holidays for the same reason.

Thousands of bikers have been riding in protest.
 https://t.co/i4IXZaWlxs

name: NPR
text: A person was shot and killed in downtown Portland last night as a pro-Trump car caravan wound its way through city streets, clashing with counterprotesters along the way. @OPB https://t.co/l7PD6F8Nut

name: NPR
text:
“That was a moment in time where the world hated South Africa. And what's the world really thinking about us in terms of the way police are killing people?” @kenshropshire asks. @OnlyAGameNPR
https://t.co/YsQTfVQgYP

name: NPR
text:
In 2004, Kenosha police shot Michael Bell's son, point-blank, in the head. The department ruled the fatal shooting as justified within 48 hours. So, Bell began fighting for outside investigations of police shootings.

His fight helped change Wisconsin law. https://t.co/7Iw7ZPgFqK

name: NPR
text:
Opinion: "We commemorate military leaders with medals and parades. Why not treat our public health officials with the same level of appreciation?" one veteran asks.
https://t.co/mmuTzhLlvH

name: NPR
text:
Critics say Attorney General William Barr isn't just using his megaphone to attack Trump's opponents and help boost his reelection efforts — they say he's also using the levers of his office's power to benefit Trump.
 https://t.co/qL26s3EYNl

name: NPR
text:
Thanks to their expressive signing, the sign language interpreters for South Africa's president have become unlikely celebrities.

"Part of the job is to embody the speaker. So when I'm on stage with him, I'm not Andiswa. I am actually the president."
https://t.co/9T01YL7do6

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: With just three months to review the 2020 census results because of a last-minute change by the Trump administration, Census Bureau officials are scrambling to decide what quality checks to toss out: https://t.co/d6h378amWI

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Chris Murphy: "It's not just about gun laws. It is also about a long history of violence as a mechanism to keep a racial caste system in line."
 https://t.co/x4wmCwX77B

name: NPR
text: Sen. Chris Murphy: "It's not just about gun laws. It is also about a long history of violence as a mechanism to keep a racial caste system in line." https://t.co/WpFKqTk0SS

name: NPR
text:
In his public comments and in interviews with NPR, Chadwick Boseman was a voice of encouragement — especially to young Black people.

Here are some highlights: https://t.co/X16YXlE5vY

name: NPR
text:
New Orleans has nearly 93,000 fewer Black residents than it did before Katrina. In comparison, there are about 8,000 fewer white people.

15 years after the storm, Lower 9th Ward resident Robert Green Sr. wants people to realize they can come back home.
https://t.co/IfjVe3KZ2X

name: NPR
text:
The number of coronavirus cases has now passed 25 million worldwide, one day after India recorded more than 78,000 new cases.

The country now outpaces both the U.S. and Brazil in daily cases.
 https://t.co/8W9hMYp0aQ

name: NPR
text: Despite the growing caseload in India, the United States continues to lead the world in both cases (more than 5.9 million) and deaths (nearly 183,000).  https://t.co/coWaF4sH2I

name: NPR
text:
Yusef Salaam spent over 6 years in prison for his wrongful conviction in the Central Park jogger case. 

Now, he and Ibo Zoboi have turned his childhood pain into poetry in a new novel in verse — about a Black teen convicted of a crime he didn't commit.
https://t.co/NRCBf83FCr

name: NPR
text: Congressional Democrats are calling the director of national intelligence's cancellation of additional in-person election security briefings "outrageous." President Trump said the change was made as an effort to prevent leaks. https://t.co/yX92h7WyjJ
